marketNews.title: The Fed Cuts Interest Rate, US-China Reach New Deal
marketNews.content:
The U.S. Federal Reserve, on Wednesday (29 Oct local time), decided to cut the U.S. policy rate by 25 basis points to a range of 3.75-4%, in line with consensus expectations. This marks the Fed’s second consecutive rate cut amid concerns over a weakening U.S. labor market. 

Nevertheless, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said the Fed does not guarantee further rate cuts at the next meeting in December 2025, given the slowdown in the release of U.S. economic data caused by a government shutdown that began in early October 2025, and because U.S. inflation remains high. For context, at the previous meeting the Fed projected two more rate cuts by the end of 2025 to a range of 3.5-3.75%. 

In addition to the rate decision, the Fed announced it will halt the reduction of its balance-sheet assets (quantitative tightening) starting 1 Dec 2025, ending the process that began in 2022, as liquidity in the money market tightens and bank reserves fall. 

In a separate development, U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday (30 Oct) that he will cut tariffs on China by 10 percentage points, reducing the total tariff on Chinese-origin imports from 57% to 47%. The announcement followed Trump’s meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in South Korea. 

Trump also said the United States has reached an agreement with China that includes: China will not impose drastic restrictions on rare-earth mineral exports to the U.S.; China will continue importing U.S. soybeans; and China will combat illegal trade of fentanyl precursors to the United States. The agreement will last one year and is expected to be renewed annually. In addition, both sides discussed U.S. chip access – including AI chips from Nvidia – amid recent Chinese restrictions on such chips and a push for domestic technology substitution. 

**Key Takeaway**

Because inflation is a key factor in the Fed’s rate-cut decision, we assess that the U.S.–China agreement – including the tariff reduction – could be a positive development for U.S. inflation outlook. However, the unresolved government shutdown remains a market uncertainty that investors should monitor. 

The market already appears to be pricing in the positive developments from the Trump-Xi meeting, as reflected in muted market reactions with several indices slipping slightly on Thursday (30 Oct) afternoon, such as the Shanghai Composite (-0.73%), Europe’s Stoxx 50 (-0.50%) and the S&P Futures (-0.04%).

marketNews.content: Top Gainers: GOTO +7.14%; DSSA +6.14%; HMSP +6.10%; DEWA +5.19%.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
Minister of Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the government plans to offer more facilities for natural-resource exporters as part of a revision to the foreign-exchange placement rules for natural-resource export earnings (DHE SDA). He did not detail the additional facilities and clarified that the DHE placement rule will not be expanded beyond the natural-resource sector. 

Selamat Sempurna (SMSM) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of roughly 230 billion rupiah or 40 rupiah per share, indicating a 2.2% dividend yield as of Thursday (30 Oct). The dividend is payable on 25 Oct 2025, with cum-dividend in the regular market and negotiations on 7 Nov 2025. This is the third interim dividend for 2025 after 35 rupiah per share in August 2025 and 25 rupiah per share in May 2025. 

Tempo Scan Pacific (TSPC) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of roughly 451 billion rupiah or 100 rupiah per share, indicating a 3.6% dividend yield as of Thursday (30 Oct). Cum-dividend in the regular market and negotiations on 7 Nov 2025, payment on 25 Nov 2025. 

Nusantara Sejahtera Raya (CNMA) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of 5 rupiah per share, indicating a 4.2% dividend yield as of Thursday (30 Oct). Cum-dividend in the regular market and negotiations on 6 Nov 2025, payment on 28 Nov 2025. 

Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of 27.77 rupiah per share, indicating a 2.1% dividend yield as of Thursday (30 Oct). Cum-dividend in the regular market and negotiations on 10 Nov 2025, payment on 28 Nov 2025. 

Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBIG) plans to conduct a share buy-back of up to 158 million (0.7%) shares with a fund allocation of up to ~360 billion rupiah for the period 30 Oct 2025-29 Jan 2026 through PT Ciptadana Sekuritas Asia. The plan does not require a shareholders’ meeting approval, following OJK’s relaxation to support market-stability. 

Lippo Cikarang (LPCK) recorded marketing sales of 1.2 trillion rupiah during 9M25 (+13.7% YoY), equal to 73% of the 2025 target of 1.65 trillion rupiah. Of the total, the house-building segment contributed 60%, commercial 34% and industrial land 6%. 

Allo Bank Indonesia (BBHI) plans to conduct a share buy-back with a fund allocation of up to ~119.4 billion rupiah for the period 30 Oct 2025-29 Jan 2026. The plan does not require a shareholders’ meeting approval, following OJK’s relaxation to support market-stability. The allocated funds are the remainder of the buy-back allocation for the periods 30 Apr-29 Jul 2025 and 30 Jul-29 Oct 2025.

marketNews.title: Investment Lesson from Hype Stocks
marketNews.content: “The smaller the fundamentals, the greater our responsibility to think.” – Husin1030

tickerNews.title: BBRI Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia recorded net profit of 14.5 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-6% YoY, +15% QoQ). The result brings 9M25 net profit to 40.8 trillion rupiah (-10% YoY), slightly below expectations at 72% of the 2025F consensus (versus a 2-year average of 73-75% actual). Pre-Provision Operating Profit fell -7% YoY / -1% YoY in 3Q25/9M25 as Non-Interest Income weakened -15% YoY / -2% YoY while Net Interest Income still grew +3% YoY. The decline in Non-Interest Income was driven by lower recovery income -35% YoY / -14% YoY in 3Q25/9M25. Meanwhile, provision expense fell -6% YoY in 3Q25 (-6% QoQ), but provision expense for 9M25 rose +14% YoY, pressuring net profit.

tickerNews.title: CMRY Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy recorded net profit of 607 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+72% YoY, +18% QoQ). The result brings 9M25 net profit to 1.6 trillion rupiah (+39% YoY), beating expectations at 88% of the 2025F consensus (versus a 3-year average of 79% actual). The 3Q25 profit increase was driven by: 1) revenue growth (+23% YoY, +1% QoQ) and 2) operating-margin expansion to 24.5% (vs. 22.3% in 3Q24 and 23.6% in 2Q25). Revenue growth in 3Q25 was supported by both segments, with “consumer foods” up +29% YoY, -9% QoQ and the “dairy” segment improving (+15% YoY, +19% QoQ). Operating expense grew moderately versus revenue, allowing operating profit of 666 billion rupiah (+34% YoY, +4% QoQ). Net financial income reached 107 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q24 loss of 62 billion rupiah, 2Q25 net financial income 17 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: HMSP Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna recorded net profit of 2.4 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: 210 billion rupiah, 3Q24: 1.9 trillion rupiah), recovering from a tax-burdened 2Q25. The result brings 9M25 net profit to 4.5 trillion rupiah (-14% YoY), below expectations at 68% of the 2025F consensus (vs. 9M24: 79% actual). Revenue in 3Q25 fell -7% YoY but was offset by a higher gross-margin of 20.2% (vs. 16.5% in 3Q24, 17.5% in 2Q25) as no excise increase occurred this year, which also lifted operating-margin to 10.4% (vs. 7.8% in 3Q24, 6.1% in 2Q25). Despite the 9M25 net-profit shortfall, quarterly revenue rose +8% QoQ, driven by a +7% QoQ volume increase and the first quarterly rise in average selling price (+1% QoQ), the first such increase since 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: WIIM Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Wismilak Inti Makmur recorded net profit of 137 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+127% YoY, +82% QoQ), bringing 9M25 net profit to 285 trillion rupiah (+37% YoY). The 3Q25/9M25 performance was supported by a revenue increase of +43% YoY / +34% YoY. Segmentally, the Machine-Cigarette (SKM) segment posted the highest growth in 3Q25/9M25 (+73% YoY / +48% YoY), driven by higher volume and higher average selling price (referencing 1Q25 data). Gross-margin fell to 21.7% in 9M25 (vs. 22.6% in 9M24), remaining stable since early 2024. Operating-margin rose to 8.3% in 9M25 (vs. 7.6% in 9M24), the highest since H1 2024.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia recorded net profit of 1.8 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+7% YoY, -2% QoQ). The result brings 9M25 net profit to 5.6 trillion rupiah (+9% YoY), in line with expectations at 72% of the 2025F consensus (vs. 9M24: 73%). The performance was supported by Net Margin Income +11% YoY / +14% YoY in 3Q25/9M25. Meanwhile, operating expense rose +19% YoY / +20% YoY, while provision expense rose +7% YoY during 9M25 despite a -15% YoY drop in 3Q25. Cost-of-Credit stood at 0.7% in 3Q25, 0.9% in 1H25, down from ~1% in 2Q25/1H25, likely the lowest level of 2025. Loan growth slowed to +13% YoY in September 2025 (vs. June 2025: +14% YoY), below the 2025 guidance range of 14-16% YoY.

tickerNews.title: BNGA Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga recorded net profit of 1.8 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+5% YoY, +10% QoQ), marking the highest quarterly net profit on record. The result brings 9M25 net profit to 5.3 trillion rupiah (+3% YoY), in line with expectations at 74% of the 2025F consensus (vs. 9M24: 75% actual). The profit was supported by a recovery in Net Interest Margin to ≥4% in 3Q25 after being pressured in the prior three quarters, and a 25% YoY rise in Non-Interest Income. Credit fell -1.4% QoQ in 3Q25, marking the second consecutive quarterly credit contraction since 2022. Cost-of-Credit rose above 1% in 3Q25, the highest since 3Q23, pushing 9M25 CoC to 0.9%, slightly above the revised 2025 guidance of 0.6-0.8%.

tickerNews.title: JSMR Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Jasa Marga recorded net profit of 857 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-10% YoY, -9% QoQ). The result brings 9M25 net profit to 2.7 trillion rupiah (-17% YoY), equal to 72% of the 2025F consensus (vs. 9M24: 73% actual). The 9M25 profit decline was mainly due to a higher tax expense of 1.21 trillion rupiah, reversing a 73 billion rupiah tax benefit in 9M24. Pre-tax profit for 9M25 still rose +23% YoY, driven by a 17% YoY drop in finance costs and a 5% YoY rise in operating profit, with a stable operating-margin of 33% (vs. 9M24: 32%).

tickerNews.title: ERAA Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Erajaya Swasembada recorded net profit of 217 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-19% YoY, +7% QoQ). The result brings 9M25 net profit to 786 billion rupiah (-1% YoY), in line with expectations at 68% of the 2025F consensus (versus a 3-year average of 68% actual). Revenue grew (+12% YoY, +9% QoQ) with 9M25 revenue up +8% YoY. The decline in net profit was driven by a 13% YoY / +10% QoQ rise in cost of goods sold and a 13% YoY / +3% QoQ rise in operating expense. Gross-margin fell to 10.9% (3Q24: 12.0%, 2Q25: 11.3%). Operating profit contracted –5% YoY but +14% QoQ, driven by expansion in ERAA’s “automotive” segment contributing 11% of total 3Q25 revenue.

tickerNews.title: ERAL Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Sinar Eka Selaras (ERAL) recorded net profit of 45 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-33% YoY, +19% QoQ), bringing 9M25 net profit to 125 billion rupiah (-21% YoY). The annual-year decline was driven by a 90% YoY surge in operating expense as the company expanded, while revenue grew double-digit (+28% YoY, +35% QoQ). Same-store sales grew +13.8% YoY in 9M25 (vs. 1H25: +15.8% YoY). Operating-margin fell to 4.2% in 3Q25 (vs. 5.8% in 3Q24), a -8% YoY change, while operating profit was down -8% YoY. The company also began reporting a new “automotive” segment contributing 11% of total 3Q25 revenue.
